verses.verse: Then I-yov <WH347> answered <WH6030> <WH8799> and said <WH559> <WH8799>,
I know <WH3045> <WH8804> it is so of a truth <WH551>: but how should man <WH582> be just <WH6663> <WH8799> with 'Elohim <WH410> ?
If he will <WH2654> <WH8799> contend <WH7378> <WH8800> with him, he cannot answer <WH6030> <WH8799> him one <WH259> of a thousand <WH505>.
He is wise <WH2450> in heart <WH3824>, and mighty <WH533> in strength <WH3581>: who hath hardened <WH7185> <WH8689> himself against him, and hath prospered <WH7999> <WH8799> ?
Which removeth <WH6275> <WH8688> the mountains <WH2022>, and they know <WH3045> <WH8804> not: which overturneth <WH2015> <WH8804> them in his anger <WH639>.
Which shaketh <WH7264> <WH8688> the earth <WH776> out of her place <WH4725>, and the pillars <WH5982> thereof tremble <WH6426> <WH8691>.
Which commandeth <WH559> <WH8802> the sun <WH2775>, and it riseht <WH2224> <WH8799> not; and sealeth up <WH2856> <WH8799> the stars <WH3556>.
Which alone spreadeth out <WH5186> <WH8802> the heavens <WH8064>, and treadeth <WH1869> <WH8802> upon the waves <WH1116> of the sea <WH3220>.
Which maketh <WH6213> <WH8802> Arcturus <WH5906>, Orion <WH3685>, and Pleiades <WH3598>, and the chambers <WH2315> of the south <WH8486>.
Which doeth <WH6213> <WH8802> great things <WH1419> past <WH369> finding out <WH2714>; yea, and wonders <WH6381> <WH8737> without number <WH4557>.
Lo, he goeth <WH5674> <WH8799> by me, and I see <WH7200> <WH8799> him not: he passeht on <WH2498> <WH8799> also, but I perceive <WH995> <WH8799> him not.
Behold, he taketh away <WH2862> <WH8799>, who can hinder <WH7725> <WH8686> him? who will say <WH559> <WH8799> unto him, What doest <WH6213> <WH8799> thou?
If 'Elohim <WH433> will not withdraw <WH7725> <WH8686> his anger <WH639>, the proud <WH7293> helpers <WH5826> <WH8802> do stoop <WH7817> <WH8804> under him.
How much less shall I answer <WH6030> <WH8799> him, and choose out <WH977> <WH8799> my words <WH1697> to reason with him?
Whom, though I were righteous <WH6663> <WH8804>, yet would I not answer <WH6030> <WH8799>, but I would make supplication <WH2603> <WH8691> to my judge <WH8199> <WH8781>.
If I had called <WH7121> <WH8804>, and he had answered <WH6030> <WH8799> me; yet would I not believe <WH539> <WH8686> that he had hearkened <WH238> <WH8686> unto my voice <WH6963>.
For he breaketh <WH7779> <WH8799> me with a tempest <WH8183>, and multiplieth <WH7235> <WH8689> my wounds <WH6482> without cause <WH2600>.
He will not suffer <WH5414> <WH8799> me to take <WH7725> <WH8687> my breath <WH7307>, but filleth <WH7646> <WH8686> me with bitterness <WH4472>.
If I speak of strength <WH3581>, lo, he is strong <WH533>: and if of judgment <WH4941>, who shall set <WH3259> <WH8686> me a time to plead ?
If I justify <WH6663> <WH8799> myself, mine own mouth <WH6310> shall condemn <WH7561> <WH8686> me: if I say, I am perfect <WH8535>, it shall also prove me perverse <WH6140> <WH8799>.
Though I were perfect <WH8535>, yet would I not know <WH3045> <WH8799> my soul <WH5315>: I would despise <WH3988> <WH8799> my life <WH2416>.
This is one <WH259> thing, therefore I said <WH559> <WH8804> it, He destroyeth <WH3615> <WH8764> the perfect <WH8535> and the wicked <WH7563>.
If the scourge <WH7752> slay <WH4191> <WH8686> suddenly <WH6597>, he will laugh <WH3932> <WH8799> at the trial <WH4531> of the innocent <WH5355>.

The earth <WH776> is given <WH5414> <WH8738> into the hand <WH3027> of the wicked <WH7563>: he covereth <WH3680> <WH8762> the faces <WH6440> of the judges <WH8199> <WH8802> thereof; if not, where <WH645>, and who is he?
Now my days <WH3117> are swifter <WH7043> <WH8804> than a post <WH7323> <WH8801>: they flee away <WH1272> <WH8804>, they see <WH7200> <WH8804> no good <WH2896>.
They are passed away <WH2498> <WH8804> as <WH5973> the swift <WH16> ships <WH591>: as the eagle <WH5404> that hasteth <WH2907> <WH8799> to the prey <WH400>.
If I say <WH559> <WH8800>, I will forget <WH7911> <WH8799> my complaint <WH7879>, I will leave off <WH5800> <WH8799> my heaviness <WH6440>, and comfort <WH1082> <WH8686> myself:
I am afraid <WH3025> <WH8804> of all my sorrows <WH6094>, I know <WH3045> <WH8804> that thou wilt not hold me innocent <WH5352> <WH8762>.
If I be wicked <WH7561> <WH8799>, why then labour <WH3021> <WH8799> I in vain <WH1892> ?
If I wash <WH7364> <WH8694> myself with <WH7950> snow water <WH4325> <WH1119>, and make my hands <WH3709> never <WH1252> <WH8676> <WH1253> so clean <WH2141> <WH8689>;
Yet <WH227> shalt thou plunge <WH2881> <WH8799> me in the ditch <WH7845>, and mine own clothes <WH8008> shall abhor <WH8581> <WH8765> me.
For he is not a man <WH376>, as I am, that I should answer <WH6030> <WH8799> him, and we should come <WH935> <WH8799> together <WH3162> in judgment <WH4941>.
Neither is <WH3426> there any daysman <WH3198> <WH8688> betwixt us, that might lay <WH7896> <WH8799> his hand <WH3027> upon us both <WH8147>.
Let him take <WH5493> his rod <WH7626> away <WH5493> <WH8686> from me, and let not his fear <WH367> terrify <WH1204> <WH8762> me:
Then would I speak <WH1696> <WH8762>, and not fear <WH3372> <WH8799> him; but it is not so with me.
